herb.name: Ginger
herb.timeboiled: Boil the ginger root and water for ten to twenty minutes.

facts.fact_1: Ginger is actually a rhizome, not a root.
facts.fact_2: The ginger plant is an herb.
facts.fact_3: Ginger is a part of the Zingiberaceae family, which also includes turmeric and cardamom.

herb.name: tawa-tawa
herb.facts: It contains contain triterpenes, phytosterols, tannins, polyphenols, and flavonoids

facts.fact_1: Traditional Chinese Medicines.
facts.fact_2: This plant grows on forest edges, under forests, river beds, valleys and grasses.

herb.name: lagundi
herb.uses: effectively treat wounds, headaches, ulcers, skin diseases, diarrhea, and the common cold,
herb.timeboiled: 2 cups of water. Boil for 10 minutes.

facts.fact_1: used to treat insect and snake bites.
facts.fact_2: Primarily it is recognized as herbal medicine for respiratory problems.

uses.use_1: the leaves have been used as a decoction to treat gout.
uses.use_2: to treat arthritis and urinary tract infections.

facts.fact_1: also commonly known as pansit-pansitan
facts.fact_2: the leaves can be eaten fresh (about a cupful) as salad or like tea.

uses.use_2: to treat dietary supplement for conditions related to the heart and blood vessels.
uses.use_3: Garlic Helps Boost Your Body's Immune System.

facts.fact_1: Garlic is one of the healthiest foods on earth. Low in calories but very high in nutrition.
facts.fact_2: Garlic is known to clear acne, simply rub a thin slice on a pimple before bed time.

species.name: Camellia
species.uses: treatment of stomachic illness, bleeding and inflammation

facts.fact_1: is a tree belonging to the Theaceae family.
facts.fact_2: is cultivated and has been used in traditional medicine in Japan, China, and Korea.
facts.fact_3: used fresh as garnishes or dried and then used in Asian cuisine.

species.name: azalea
species.uses: he root is used in the treatment of arthritis, rheumatism and traumatic injuries
species.colors: yellow, pink, orange, red and white

facts.fact_1: the word azalea comes from the Greek word meaning dry.
facts.fact_2: azaleas are the national flower of Nepal.
facts.fact_3: they're also the flower for the zodiac sign of Sagittarius.
facts.fact_4: some azaleas produce so many flowers at once that you can hardly see the leaves!

species.name: Sunrose
species.uses: which are useful in rock gardens and wild gardens
species.colors: red, orange, yellow, pink and white.

facts.fact_1: also called rock rose
facts.fact_2: is a rushlike shrub that grows to 30 cm (1 foot) in height (but with lower varieties) and is native to California.
facts.fact_3: related plants of the genus Cistus (family Cistaceae)

species.name: Australian fuchsia
species.uses: indicates confiding love, given as a way of expressing your trust for someone
species.colors: cream, red, green with contrasting color tips.

facts.fact_1: Fuchsia flowers are also associated with different myths
facts.fact_2: has long, narrow fuchsia-like flowers that are ½-1 inch long and can be red, pink or orange

species.name: henna
species.uses: used for severe diarrhea caused by a parasite (amoebic dysentery), cancer, enlarged spleen, headache, jaundice, and skin conditions.

facts.fact_1: the Henna paste symbolizes good health and prosperity in marriage
facts.fact_2: Warnings. When taken by mouth: Henna is UNSAFE when taken by mouth.
facts.fact_3: It can cause stomach upset, muscle breakdown, kidney failure, destruction of red blood cells (hemolytic anemia), and death.

uses.use_1: tulsi is recommended as a treatment for a range of conditions including anxiety, cough, asthma, diarrhea
uses.use_2: fever, dysentery, arthritis, eye diseases, otalgia, indigestion, hiccups, vomiting, gastric, cardiac and genitourinary disorders, back pain, skin diseases, ringworm, insect, snake and scorpion bites and malaria.

facts.fact_1: Tulsi is an aromatic shrub in the basil family Lamiaceae (tribe ocimeae)
facts.fact_2: Tulsi contains Vitamin C and other anti-oxidants such as eugenol which protects the heart from harmful effects of free radicals

climb.name: beans
climb.uses: These nutrients may help to reduce the risk of certain cancers, like breast, colon, and prostate

facts.fact_1: Great Source of Iron, They're rich in dietary fiber.
facts.fact_2: Most beans are a good source of folate, a water-soluble vitamin that's vital for healthy fetal development.

climb.sideeffects: eating beans everyday can Causes Gastric Problems and cause migraine, and People can also be allergic to beans.

climb.name: grapevine
climb.uses: grapevine leaf preparations can be used for treatment of chronic (long-term) venous insufficiency

facts.fact_1: used not only for wine but also for fresh fruit, dried fruit, and juice production.
facts.fact_2: the oldest known grapevine is over 400 years old and can be found in Yarra, Slovenia.

climb.sideeffects: Side effects that have been reported with grapevine leaf medicines include hypersensitivity (allergic)skin reactions.

climb.name: pea plant
climb.uses: dried peas are commonly used in soups

facts.fact_1: a good source of vitamins C and E, zinc, and other antioxidants.
facts.fact_2: help reduce inflammation and lower your risk of chronic conditions.

climb.sideeffects: cause bloating, an uncomfortable swelling of the stomach often accompanied by gas and flatulence.

climb.name: money plant

facts.fact_1: they are believed to bring good wealth to the home.
facts.fact_2: create positive energy.

climb.sideeffects: poisoning can cause swelling of the mouth, throat, and tongue, as well as vomiting and diarrhea..

facts.fact_1: low in calories and provides small amounts of vitamin C, folate, calcium, iron, zinc and B vitamins.
facts.fact_2: rich in fiber and is believed to help aid in healthy digestion.

climb.name: honeysuckle

facts.fact_1: can be evergreen or deciduous.
facts.fact_2: a paradise for wildlife, with its sweet, heady fragrance calling to nearby species.

climb.sideeffects: stomach pain, diarrhea, irregular heartbeat and vomiting.

tree.name: oak
tree.uses: furniture, joinery, flooring, panelling, decking and veneers
tree.height: 40-80' and a spread of 60-100' at maturity..

facts.fact_1: America's national tree
facts.fact_2: Oaks are large, deciduous trees with a strong, durable wood.
facts.fact_3: Oak is used to make alcohol.

tree.name: pine
tree.facts: nown for their needle-like leaves and distinctive cones.

tree.name: maple
tree.uses: furniture, flooring, cabinetry, paneling, veneer, musical instruments, tool handles, cutting boards, butcher blocks, wooden bowls, boxes and crates

facts.fact_1: Maple trees can live to 200 years and beyond and have been tapped for 150 years or more.
facts.fact_2: its ability to produce a unique sap that can be turned into syrup.

tree.name: redwood
tree.uses: can create Boxes, bins, bats, barns, bridges, bungalows

facts.fact_1: They are Ancient
facts.fact_2: They Used to Host Geese.

uses.use_2: used in many traditional Japanese sweets and tea.

facts.fact_1: symbolize both birth and death, beauty and violence
facts.fact_2: represents a time of renewal and optimism.

uses.use_2: The leaves and fruit pulp have been used to reduce fever and stimulate the immune system.

facts.fact_1: Baobab trees are among the longest-lived trees.
facts.fact_2: known as "The Tree of Life".

facts.fact_1: contains vitamin C, potassium and magnesium.
facts.fact_2: They can grow with or without seeds.

creep.name: strawberry
creep.uses: deliver vitamins, fiber, and particularly high levels of antioxidants known as polyphenols

facts.fact_1: Strawberries are the only fruit with seeds on the outside.
facts.fact_2: Strawberries are the first fruit to ripen in spring.
facts.fact_3: Strawberries are members of the rose family.

creep.name: pumpkin
creep.uses: pumpkin seeds as an official medicine for parasite elimination

facts.fact_1: There are hundreds of varieties of pumpkin
facts.fact_2: Pumpkins are good for your hearing!
facts.fact_3: Pumpkin is used to make soups, desserts and breads, and many Americans include pumpkin pie in their Thanksgiving meals

creep.name: sweet potatoes
creep.aveweight: One large sweet potato weighs roughly ½-lb

facts.fact_1: Sweet potatoes are great sources of vitamin A, vitamin C, beta carotene, fiber and potassium
facts.fact_2: Sweet potatoes can be white, yellow, red, purple or orange

creep.name: cucumber
creep.uses: keep you hydrated plus,the fiber boost they give you helps you stay regular and avoid constipation.

facts.fact_1: made up of mostly water, but also contain vitamins A, C and B6.
facts.fact_2: It has large leaves and bright yellow flowers that form long, green fruit with tapered ends.

uses.use_2: cabbage leaf treatment helps reduce pain in breast engorgement and lengthens breastfeeding duration.

facts.fact_1: low in saturated fat and cholesterol
facts.fact_2: rinking juiced cabbage is known to assist in curing stomach and intestinal ulcers.effects of free radicals
